intro: Orthaea ferreyrae, commonly known as the Ferreyra's orthaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Orthaea ferreyrae is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
